intro: Diplotaxis lagascana var. intricata, commonly known as the intricate synbranch, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important crops and weeds. The plant is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit and small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. This variety is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid conditions.
